questions.question: Can you move around and use steps without difficulty?

answers.label: No
answers.value: Question text of follow-up question (string)

questions.question: What is the furthest you can move safely on level ground without needing to stop?
questions.hint: Answer this question even if you need a walking stick, manual wheelchair or other aid to help you.

questions.question: After moving once, how far can you move again within a short time without it causing you significant discomfort or exhaustion?
Can you go up or down two steps without being helped by another person even with the support of a handrail?
Can you stand and sit without difficulty?

answers.label: No
answers.value: Question text of follow-up question (string)

questions.question: If two seats are placed next to each other could you move from one to the other without help from someone else?

How long could you either sit or stand or both at a workstation for the majority of time without help from someone else before it caused you significant discomfort or exhaustion and you had to move away?
Can you reach up with both your arms without difficulty?

answers.label: No
answers.value: Question text of the follow-up question (string)

questions.question: Can you pick up and move things without any difficulty?

answers.label: No
answers.value: Question text of the follow-up question (string)

questions.question: Can you pick up and move a half litre (pint) carton of liquid?
Can you pick up and move a litre (2 pint) carton of liquid?
Can you pick up and move a light but bulky object like an empty cardboard box?
Can you use one hand to press a button, for example on a telephone key pad?
Can you turn the pages of a book with one or both hands?
Can you pick up a pound coin (or something similar) with one hand?
Can you use one hand to operate a computer keyboard or mouse (it does not matter whether or not it has been specially adapted for you or you know how to use a computer)?
Can you communicate with other people without any difficulty?

answers.label: No
answers.value: Question text of the follow-up question (string)

questions.question: Can you make yourself understood through speaking, writing, typing, or any other means you normally use, without help from another person?

answers.label: All of the time
answers.value: Question text of the follow-up question (string)

answers.label: Most of the time
answers.value: Question text of the follow-up question (string)

answers.label: Sometimes
answers.value: Question text of the follow-up question (string)

answers.label: Not very often
answers.value: Question text of the follow-up question (string)

questions.question: Can you give a simple message to someone such as a message explaining how dangerous something is?
How difficult would you find it to pass a simple message to a stranger?
Can you understand other people without any difficulty?

answers.label: No
answers.value: Question text of the follow-up question (string)

questions.question: Which of these best describes how well you can understand a simple message such as the location of a fire escape?

answers.label: I can't understand at all due to hearing/sight difficulties
Very difficult to understand due to hearing/sight difficulties
Quite difficult to understand due to hearing/sight difficulties
None of these apply to me

questions.question: Can you cross the road on your own, without needing help from someone else whether or not you need to use a guide dog or other aid?
Can you move around an unfamiliar place without help from someone else whether or not you need to use a guide dog or other aid?
Can you move around a familiar place without help from someone else whether or not you need to use a guide dog or other aid?
Can you learn to do everyday tasks without any difficulty?

answers.label: No
answers.value: Question text of the follow-up question (string)

questions.question: Which of these best describes whether you can learn to do a simple task such as setting an alarm clock?

answers.label: I would not have a problem learning a task like this
I can sometimes learn some simple tasks
I would never be able to learn how to complete a task like this
I would never be able to learn how to complete a task like this because I have learning difficulties or mental health impairments

questions.question: Can you learn something complex such as how to use a washing machine?

answers.label: It varies
answers.value: Question text of the follow-up question (string)

questions.question: Can you learn something more complicated than how to use a washing machine?

answers.label: It varies
answers.value: Question text of the follow-up question (string)

questions.question: Can you stay safe when doing everyday tasks such as boiling water or using sharp objects?

answers.label: No
answers.value: Question text of the follow-up question (string)

questions.question: How often do you need someone to stay with you to keep you safe because you are not aware how everyday hazards (such as boiling water or sharp objects) can injure you/other people or cause damage to property/possessions?
Do you have any learning impairments of mental disorders which mean you are at significant risk of harm or injury to yourself or others?

answers.label: No
answers.value: Question text of the follow-up question (string)

questions.question: Do you have any learning impairments or mental disorders which mean someone needs to be with you most of the time to prevent significant risk of damage to property or possessions?
Can you manage to plan, start and finish daily tasks without any difficulty?

Thinking about your mental health, which of these best describes how often you could reliably start and finish at least two personal actions (such as getting up, washing and dressing, cooking a meal or going shopping) one after the other?

answers.label: Cannot most of the time because of mental health
Cannot frequently because of mental health

questions.question: How well do you cope with any change?

answers.label: I can't cope to the extent I can't manage my day-to-day life at all
I can't cope to the extent is causes me a lot of distress
answers.value: Question text of the follow-up question (string)

answers.label: I can cope, but it will make me anxious or worried
answers.value: Question text of the follow-up question (string)

answers.label: I can cope without any difficulties
answers.value: Question text of the follow-up question (string)

questions.question: If you are due to meet someone, but a few days before they change the date, how well would you cope with this change to your routine?

answers.label: I can't cope to the extent I can't manage my day-to-day life at all
I can't cope, it would make day-to-day life very difficult to manage
I can't cope. It would make me feel anxious
answers.value: Question text of the follow-up question (string)

answers.label: I can cope without any difficulties
answers.value: Question text of the follow-up question (string)

answers.label: I have a learning difficulty or mental health problem which makes it impossible to cope with any change and would make my day-to-day life unmanageable

questions.question: If you are asked to attend an appointment, but on the day you are contacted to say the time has been changed, how well would you cope with this change?

answers.label: I can't cope at all to the extent I would not be able to manage day-to-day life
I can't cope, it would make day-to-day life very difficult to manage
It would make day-to-day life difficult to manage
answers.value: Question text of the follow-up question (string)

answers.label: I can cope without any difficulties
answers.value: Question text of the follow-up question (string)

answers.label: I would not meet anyone in the first place

questions.question: Can you go out on your own?

answers.label: No
answers.value: Question text of the follow-up question (string)

questions.question: Can you leave home and go out to places you know?

answers.label: Only if someone goes with me

questions.question: How well do you cope in social situations?

answers.label: I find it very difficult
answers.value: Question text of the follow-up question (string)

answers.label: I have some difficulty
answers.value: Question text of the follow-up question (string)

questions.question: Which of these best describes how you relate to other people in social situations?

answers.label: I have no difficulty relating to other people
I can sometimes relate to other people, but I will feel anxious or distressed
answers.value: Question text of the follow-up question (string)

answers.label: I can never relate to other people
answers.value: Question text of the follow-up question (string)

answers.label: I never meet other people because it makes me quite distressed
answers.value: Question text of the follow-up question (string)

answers.label: I never speak to other people, socially because it makes me extremely distressed

questions.question: Which of these best describes how you feel when you engage socially with someone you do not know?

answers.label: I do not have any problems meeting new people
I will feel anxious or distressed sometimes
I never meet people I do not know because it makes me extremely distressed
Most of the time it is not possible because I get extremely distressed
I will feel anxious or distressed all the time

questions.question: Do you have learning or mental health difficulties which affect how you behave towards other people?

answers.label: Yes
answers.value: Question text of the follow-up question (string)

answers.label: It varies
answers.value: Question text of the follow-up question (string)

questions.question: How often do you behave in an uncontrollable aggressive way towards other people?

answers.label: Not every day, but quite often

questions.question: Can you get food to and from your mouth without physical help form someone else?
Can you get food to and from your own mouth without repeatedly stopping, experiencing breathlessness or severe discomfort?
Can you get food to and from your own mouth without someone regularly telling you to do it?
Do you have a severe mood or behavioural disorder which means you can't get food or drink to your own mouth without physical help from someone else?
Do you have a severe mood or behavioural disorder which means you need someone with you to tell you to get food or drink to your own mouth?
Can you chew or swallow food or drink?
Can you chew or swallow food and drink without repeatedly stopping, experiencing breathlessness or severe discomfort?
Do you need someone with you to help you repeatedly swallow food or drink?

answers.label: Yes, but not all the time

questions.question: Do you have a severe mood or behavioural disorder which means you can't chew or swallow food?
Do you have a severe mood or behavioural disorder which means you need someone with you regularly to tell you to chew or swallow food or drink?
